page.title: 19Animal Sanctuary
page.content: The Margaret Green Foundation Trust has an animal sanctuary at Hyde, well away from residential areas where the noise of barking would constitute a nuisance. Here dogs are cared for until new homes can be found for them. No dog is destroyed unless it is past veterinary help. Of the dogs taken into the kennels some are simply abandoned and straying, some are unwanted by their owners who ask for help, and some have to be rescued from cruel situations. Cruelty takes the forms of neglect and physical damage, sometimes due to ignorance, and the kennels are unable to meet the demands for help with unwanted or difficult pets. The Trust is dependent on voluntary contributions. Under the l9ll Protection of Animals Act, the Trust may bring legal action "for causing unnecessary suffering".
